titles.title: To require States to impose criminal penalties on persons who willfully fail to pay child support, as a condition of Federal funding of State child support enforcement programs.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Human Resources.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

bill.summary: 1/7/1997--Introduced. Amends the Social Security Act to require States, as a condition of Federal funding of State child support enforcement programs, to impose criminal penalties on persons who willfully fail to pay child support.
